abstract.p: Westchester County publishes two booklets to help residents understand more about environmental issues: Frequently Asked Questions and newsletter From Town to Tap (S)

block.p: The county has published two booklets to help residents understand more about environmental issues. ''Frequently Asked Questions'' includes six fact sheets, each dealing with a different water pollution topic. The other publication, ''From Town to Tap,'' is a newsletter that features stories about successful restoration efforts. Both publications can be viewed on the county's Web site: ''Frequently Asked Questions'' is at westchestergov.com/planning/environmental/default.htm, and ''From Town to Tap'' is at westchestergov.com/planning/watershed/default.htm. They can also be requested from the County Planning Department by calling (914) 285-4422.
